content:
I'd like to gather some more opinions on this PR by @Pol'tta / Miyahara Kō . The issue is that the declarations involving continued fractions are currently quite long so this PR shortens them to abbreviations. In fact, the original names in mathlib#1433 which added them were similarly short but @Sébastien Gouëzel and @Kim Morrison suggested using longer names instead.

In my comment I suggested possibly adding abbreviations or notations to those files and then shortening the files everywhere in place of the long names, but thinking over it I can't think of any other places in mathlib where we do that sort of thing, so I'm not sure if that's what we should really do here.

GeneralizedContinuedFraction is in the root namespace. You can not replace it with GCF in the root namespace, because it's too short and generic. And I still think that GCF, SCF and so on (which are not really standard names in the literature) are just not expressive enough.

I would have guessed Greatest Common Factor and Smallest Common Factor :-)

I had never really appreciated this before. Johan was talking to me about a PR recently and I said "why don't you just merge it on the train" and he said "I read it and I don't understand the notation and it turns out that it's full of abbreviations". So this is more evidence that hand-rolled abbreviations, whilst more convenient for the writer of the code, are making things less easy for everyone else.

(Trying to see if there's a way forward on this PR) Would abbreviations like GenContFrac (or some variant thereof) be acceptable, even if non-standard? Or should @Pol'tta / Miyahara Kō close this and rework the dependent PRs (#13555, #13590) to use the current names everywhere? (Or is there some other option I'm missing?)
I was coming here to suggest GenContFrac as well
I agree the current names are unbearably lengthy
Another option would be to have shorter names or abbreviations, but in a ContinuedFraction namespace.
(That solves the root namespace issue, but not the reviewing issue).
The issue in Johan's PR story was that the abbreviations had all been merged in a previous PR and hence the relevant lines weren't visible in github.
fwiwi: I would be happy with GenContFrac but completely confused by GCF.
I'll also be happy with GenContFrac. Maybe put it in a ContinuedFraction namespace to clarify things even more?
Let's learn to love namespaces. Later us will be grateful.

"Namespaces are one honking great idea -- let's do more of those!"
-- zen of python
